SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Apple
Represents an Apple in the game, which is a type of food that the snake can eat.
BodyPiece
Represents a single segment of the snake's body.
ColisionChecker
Provides methods for collision detection between geometric shapes.
CommonFood
Abstract class representing common functionality for all types of food in the game.
CommonGameObject
Abstract class representing a common game object with basic properties and behavior.
CommonGameScene
Represents the game scene where gameplay takes place.
Constants
Contains constant values used throughout the game.
Direction
Represents the directions in which an entity can move.
EditScene
Scene for editing game elements, including obstacles and food.
EndScene
EndScene is a class representing the end screen of the game where the final score and high score are displayed.
FileUtils
Utility class for handling player score saving and loading operations.
Food
Interface representing a food object in the game.
FoodFactory
Factory class for creating different types of food objects in the game.
FoodFactory.FoodType
Enum representing the different types of food that can be created.
GameObject
Interface for game objects that can be updated and drawn on the screen.
GameScene
Represents the game scene where gameplay takes place.
GameTest
 
KeyL
Handles keyboard input by implementing the KeyListener interface.
Lizard
Represents a lizard food item that moves around the game field.
Main
 
MenuItem
Represents a menu item in a user interface, which can be drawn, hovered over, and clicked.
MenuItemBuilder
Builder class for creating instances of MenuItem.
MenuScene
Represents the main menu scene of the game.
Mouse
Represents a mouse food item that moves around the game field.
MouseL
Handles mouse inputs by implementing the MouseAdapter and MouseMotionListener interfaces.
NicknameDialog
A dialog for entering a nickname.
Obstacle
Represents an obstacle in the game that the snake can collide with.
Rect
Represents a rectangle with a specified position (x, y) and size (width, height).
Scene
Represents a scene in the game, such as the main menu, gameplay scene, or game over screen.
Snake
Represents the snake in the game.
Time
Utility class for managing time-related operations.
TimeTest
 
Window
Represents the main window of the application.
